info.title: Klavis AI (https://www.klavis.ai)
info.description: Klavis AI - Open Source MCP Integrations for AI Applications

post.description:
Calls a tool on a specific remote MCP server, used for function calling. Eliminates the need for manual MCP code implementation.
Under the hood, Klavis will instantiates an MCP client and establishes a connection with the remote MCP server to call the tool.

Lists all tools available for a specific remote MCP server in various AI model formats.

This eliminates the need for manual MCP code implementation and format conversion.
Under the hood, Klavis instantiates an MCP client and establishes a connection 
with the remote MCP server to retrieve available tools.

Create a Strata MCP server.

Parameters:
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to add all available Klavis integration, a list of specific server names, or null to add no servers
- externalServers: Optional list of external MCP servers to validate and add

Add servers to an existing Strata MCP server.

Note: After adding servers, you need to reconnect the MCP server so that list_tool can be updated with the new servers.

Parameters:
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to add all available servers, a list of specific server names, or null to add no servers
- externalServers: Optional list of external MCP servers to validate and add

delete.description:
Delete servers from an existing Strata MCP server.

Note: After deleting servers, you need to reconnect the MCP server so that list_tool can be updated to reflect the removed servers.

Parameters:
- strataId: The strata server ID (path parameter)
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to delete all available Klavis integration, a list of specific server names, or null to delete no servers
- externalServers: Query parameter - comma-separated list of external server names to delete

Returns separate lists for deleted Klavis servers and deleted external servers.

parameters.name: servers

schema.description: List of Klavis integration to delete (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to delete all Klavis integration, or null to delete no servers.
schema.title: Servers

parameters.description: List of Klavis integration to delete (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to delete all Klavis integration, or null to delete no servers.

parameters.name: externalServers

schema.description: Comma-separated list of external server names to delete
schema.title: Externalservers

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of external server names to delete

get.description:
Get information about an existing Strata MCP server instance.

Returns the strata URL, connected klavis servers, connected external servers (with URLs), 
and authentication URLs for klavis servers.

post.description:
Sets authentication data for a specific integration within a Strata MCP server.

Accepts either API key authentication or general authentication data.

Creates a URL for a specified MCP server,
validating the request with an API key and user details.
Returns the existing server URL if it already exists for the user.
If OAuth is configured for the server, also returns the base OAuth authorization URL.

Creates an instance id for a self-hosted MCP server,
validating the request with an API key and user details.
The main purpose of this endpoint is to create an instance id for a self-hosted MCP server.
The instance id is used to identify and store the auth metadata in the database.
Returns the existing instance id if it already exists for the user.

get.description:
Checks the details of a specific server connection instance using its unique ID and API key,
returning server details like authentication status and associated server/platform info.

parameters.name: instance_id

schema.description: The ID of the connection instance whose status is being checked. This is returned by the Create API.
schema.title: Instance Id

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance whose status is being checked. This is returned by the Create API.

delete.description: Deletes authentication data for a specific server connection instance.

parameters.name: instance_id

schema.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete auth for.
schema.title: Instance Id

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete auth for.

delete.description:
Completely removes a server connection instance using its unique ID,
deleting all associated data from the system.

parameters.name: instance_id

schema.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete.
schema.title: Instance Id

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete.

get.description: Get tools information for any MCP server.

parameters.name: server_name

schema.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

parameters.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

parameters.name: format

schema.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

parameters.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

get.description: Get all MCP servers with their basic information including id, name, and description.

post.description:
Sets authentication data for a specific instance.
Accepts either API key authentication or general authentication data.
This updates the auth_metadata for the specified instance.

get.description:
Retrieves the auth data for a specific instance that the API key owner controls.
Includes access token, refresh token, and other authentication data.

This endpoint includes proper ownership verification to ensure users can only access
authentication data for instances they own. It also handles token refresh if needed.

parameters.name: instance_id

schema.description: The ID of the connection instance to get auth data for.
schema.title: Instance Id

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance to get auth data for.

post.description: Saves OAuth white labeling information, or updates existing information if the `client_id` matches.

get.description: Retrieves white labeling information for a specific OAuth client ID.
Get all MCP server instances information by user ID and platform name.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The external user ID
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: The external user ID

parameters.name: platform_name

schema.description: The platform name (optional)
schema.title: Platform Name

parameters.description: The platform name (optional)

delete.description:
Delete a user and all associated data by user_id.
Users cannot delete their own accounts.
This operation will permanently remove all user data.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The identifier for the user to delete.
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: The identifier for the user to delete.

get.description:
Start Slack OAuth flow

Parameters:
- instance_id: Identifier for the instance requesting authorization
- client_id: Optional client ID for white labeling
- scope: Optional scopes to request (comma-separated)
- user_scope: Optional user-specific scopes to request (comma-separated)
- redirect_url: Optional URL to redirect to after authorization completes

- redirect_url: Optional URL to redirect to after authorization completes

token.title: Token
token.description: The API key to save (token field)

api_key.title: Api Key
api_key.description: The API key to save (api_key field)

serverUrl.title: Serverurl
serverUrl.description: The full URL for connecting to the MCP server

toolName.title: Toolname
toolName.description: The name of the tool to call

toolArgs.title: Toolargs
toolArgs.description: The input parameters for the tool

connectionType.description: The connection type to use for the MCP server. Default is STREAMABLE_HTTP.

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include when connecting to the server

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the API call was successful

result.description: The result of the tool call, if successful

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message, if the tool call failed

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the tool call

isError.title: Iserror
isError.description: Whether the tool call was successful

CallToolResult.title: CallToolResult
CallToolResult.description: The server's response to a tool call.

serverName.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

userId.title: Userid
userId.description: The unique identifier for the user. The server instance along with the all the authentication data will belong to that specific user only. It can be a UUID from the database, a unique email address from the user, etc.

instanceId.title: Instanceid
instanceId.description: The unique identifier for this specific server connection instance.

oauthUrl.title: Oauthurl
oauthUrl.description: The OAuth authorization URL for the specified server, if OAuth is configured.

serverName.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

userId.title: Userid
userId.description: The unique identifier for the user. The server instance along with the all the authentication data will belong to that specific user only. It can be a UUID from the database, a unique email address from the user, etc.

platformName.title: Platformname
platformName.description: The name of the platform associated with the user. Optional.

connectionType.description: The connection type to use for the MCP server. Default is STREAMABLE_HTTP.

serverUrl.title: Serverurl
serverUrl.description: The full URL for connecting to the MCP server, including the instance ID.

instanceId.title: Instanceid
instanceId.description: The unique identifier for this specific server connection instance.

oauthUrl.title: Oauthurl
oauthUrl.description: The OAuth URL for authentication if available, supports white label if configured.

server_name.description: Optional. The name of the server

account_id.title: Account Id
account_id.description: Optional. The UUID of the account

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the external server

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of the external MCP server

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Optional HTTP headers used when connecting to the external server

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the external server

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of the external MCP server

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include when connecting to the external server (e.g., for bearer authentication)

data.title: Data
data.description: Any other general authentication data to save

authData.title: Authdata
authData.description: Complete authentication data including access token, refresh token, scope, expiration, and platform-specific data

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if the request failed

instanceId.title: Instanceid
instanceId.description: The unique identifier of the connection instance.

authNeeded.title: Authneeded
authNeeded.description: Indicates whether authentication is required for this server instance.

isAuthenticated.title: Isauthenticated
isAuthenticated.description: Indicates whether the instance is authenticated successfully.

serverName.title: Servername
serverName.description: The name of the MCP server associated with the instance.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The platform associated with the instance.

externalUserId.title: Externaluserid
externalUserId.description: The user's identifier on the external platform.

oauthUrl.title: Oauthurl
oauthUrl.description: The OAuth URL for authentication if available, supports white label if configured.

serverUrl.title: Serverurl
serverUrl.description: The full URL for connecting to the MCP server

connectionType.description: The connection type to use for the MCP server. Default is STREAMABLE_HTTP.

format.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include when connecting to the server

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the list tools request was successful

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: List of tools in the requested format

format.description: The format of the returned tools

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message, if the request failed

instanceId.title: Instanceid
instanceId.description: The unique identifier for the connection instance

servers.title: Servers
servers.description: List of Klavis integration to add (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to add all Klavis integration, or null to add no servers.

externalServers.title: Externalservers
externalServers.description: Optional list of external MCP servers to add with their URLs. Each server will be validated before being added.

addedServers.title: Addedservers
addedServers.description: List of Klavis integration that were added

addedExternalServers.title: Addedexternalservers
addedExternalServers.description: List of external MCP servers that were added with name and URL

oauthUrls.title: Oauthurls
oauthUrls.description: Map of connected integration to OAuth URL, supports white labeling if configured

apiKeyUrls.title: Apikeyurls
apiKeyUrls.description: Map of connected integration to API key setup URL

userId.title: Userid
userId.description: The unique identifier for the user. The server instance along with the all the authentication data will belong to that specific user only. It can be a UUID from the database, a unique email address from the user, etc.

servers.title: Servers
servers.description: List of Klavis MCP servers to enable (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to add all Klavis MCP servers, or null to add no servers.

externalServers.title: Externalservers
externalServers.description: Optional list of external MCP servers to add with their URLs. Each server will be validated before being added.

enable_auth_handling.title: Enable Auth Handling
enable_auth_handling.description: Whether to enable authentication handling. Default is True.

strataServerUrl.title: Strataserverurl
strataServerUrl.description: URL to connect to the Strata MCP server

addedServers.title: Addedservers
addedServers.description: List of Klavis integration that were added

addedExternalServers.title: Addedexternalservers
addedExternalServers.description: List of external MCP servers that were added with name and URL

oauthUrls.title: Oauthurls
oauthUrls.description: Map of connected integration to OAuth URL, supports white labeling if configured

apiKeyUrls.title: Apikeyurls
apiKeyUrls.description: Map of connected integration to API key setup URL

deletedServers.title: Deletedservers
deletedServers.description: List of integration that were deleted

deletedExternalServers.title: Deletedexternalservers
deletedExternalServers.description: List of external MCP server names that were deleted

strataServerUrl.title: Strataserverurl
strataServerUrl.description: URL to connect to the Strata MCP server

connectedServers.title: Connectedservers
connectedServers.description: List of available integration currently connected to this strata

connectedExternalServers.title: Connectedexternalservers
connectedExternalServers.description: List of external servers with name and URL currently connected to this strata

oauthUrls.title: Oauthurls
oauthUrls.description: Map of connected integration to OAuth URL, supports white labeling if configured

apiKeyUrls.title: Apikeyurls
apiKeyUrls.description: Map of connected integration to API key setup URL

serverName.description: The name of the Klavis MCP server to set authentication for (e.g., 'GitHub', 'Jira')

data.title: Data
